Question: A contract is what kind of agreement? (A) Dictated (B) Signed (C) Legally enforceable  (D) Mandatory
What kind of agreement is legally enforceable in court? (A) Document (B) Contract (C) Signed Document (D) Written docuemnt
What kind of agreement gives rise to legally enforceable obligations? (A) Document (B) Signed docuemnt (C) Written document (D) Contract
Wich of the following is not a classification of a contract? (A) Formal (B) Simple (C) Express (D) Basic
A formal contract is also known as ___ contract(A) Speciality (B) Simple (C) Express (D) Basic
Another name for a formal contract is (A) Implied (B) A contract under seal (C) Express (D) Basic
A ___ contract is a contract made by deed (A) Formal  (B) A contract under seal (C) Express (D) Basic
What is the name of a contract that is not made by deed? (A) Formal (B) Simple (C) Unilateral (D) Multilateral
What is the name of a contract that has all the terms clearly stated and agreed upon? (A) Implied (B) A contract under seal (C) Express (D) Unilateral
What kind of contract has all the materials terms spelled out? (A) Express (B) A contract under seal (C) Implied (D) Bilateral
A ___ contract is a contract that does not have all it's terms expressly stated (A) Implied (B) A contract under seal (C) Express (D) Basic
How many years is the limitation period for a specialty contract? (A) 6 (B) 14 (C) 16 (D) 12
How many years is the limitation period for a simple contract? (A) 6 (B) 14 (C) 16 (D) 13
A ___ contract involves one party promising to do something in exchange for the promise of the other party. (A) Express (B) Unilateral (C) Implied (D) Bilateral
A ___ contract imposes an obligation only on the promisor (A) Express (B) Unilateral (C) Implied (D) Bilateral
What kind of contract absolves a promisee from any obligation to the promisor in return for a promise? (A) Express (B) Unilateral (C) Implied (D) Bilateral
Which of the following is not a requirement for the formation of a contract? (A) Offer (B) Acceptance (C) Consideration (D) Deal
Which of the following is not a requirement for the formation of a contract? (A) Deal (B) Acceptance (C) Capacity to contract (D) intention to create legal relation
___ is a definite undertaking or proposal entered by a person with the intention of a legally binding agreement (A) Offer (B) Acceptance (C) Consideration (D) Deal
A person making an offer is known as ___ (A) Offer person (B) Offeree (C) Offeror (D) Offer
A person who an offer is made to is known as ___ (A) Offer person (B) Offeree (C) Offeror (D) Offer
When does an offer becomes effective? (A) When an agreement is made (B) When it reaches the offeree (C) When it it leaves the offeror's place (D) When it is signed by the offeror
___ is a preliminary move that may or may not lead to a contract (A) Offer (B) Invitation to treat (C) Invitation offer  (D) Treat
Which of the following is an invitation to treat? (A) Auctioneer's request for bids (B) A company offer of a reward to the whole world (C) None of the above (D) All of the above
Is a person entitled to an offer he/she is not aware of? (A) Yes (B) No (C) Maybe (D) Not sure

The following terminates an offer except (A) Death of offeror or offeree (B) Non-acceptance within stipulated time for acceptance (C) Acceptance of the offer (D) Revocation before acceptance by the offeror

In which instance can an offer not be revoked? (A) Before acceptance by the offeree (B) After the stipulated time of acceptance (C) Promise to keep the offer open due to a consideration given by the offeree (D) Before the offer gets to the offeree

In which instance can an offer not be revoked? (A) Acceptance by offeree before reciept of revocation  (B) After the stipulated time of acceptance (C) Promise to keep the offer open due to a consideration given by the offeree (D) Before the offer gets to the offeree
___ is the assent by the offeree to the terms of an offer proposed by an offeror (A) Offer (B) Acceptance (C) Consideration (D) Capacity to contract
___ triggers a contract into existence? (A) Offer (B) Acceptance (C) Consideration (D) Capacity to contract
___ is as a result of the inclusion of a fresh term to an offer's acceptance (A) Negotiation (B) Counteroffer (C) All of the above  (D) None of the above
A counter offer ___ an original offer (A) Upholds (B) Destroys (C) Strengthens (D) Validates

In what case is an acceptance of an offer invalid (A) Acceptance through prefered method stated in the offer (B) Acceptance through any method irrespective of directive in the offer (C) None of th above (D) All of the above
Is communication of acceptance necessary in respect to offers that need to be acted upon if it is not expressly stated in the offer (A) Yes (B) No (C) Maybe (D) None of the above
Is a mental acceptance of an offer valid? (A) Yes (B) No (C) Maybe (D) None of the above
When can an acceptance be valid? (A) Before acceptance gets to the offeror (B) After the acceptance has been sent to the offeror (C) When the acceptance gets to the offeror (D) None of the above
Can a contract be valid if the acceptance is subject to a conditon that is not fulfilled? (A) Yes (B) No (C) Maybe (D) None of the above
___ is the benefit or promise received by a party in exchange for the benefit or promise conferred on the other party (A) Offer (B) Acceptance (C) Consideration (D) Deal
___ consideration is an act done by one party in exchange for a promise or action by the other party (A) Offer (B) Executed (C) Executory (D) Acceptance
___ consideration takes the form of a promise to be performed in the future (A) Offer (B) Executed (C) Executory (D) Acceptance
___ consideration takes the form of a promise to be performed immediately (A) Past (B) Executed (C) Executory (D) Acceptance
___ consideration is an act promised by one party in exchange for a promise or act by the other party (A) Past (B) Executed (C) Executory (D) Acceptance
Which of the following consideration enforces a contract? (A) Executory (B) Executed (C) Both A and B (D) Past
___ consideration involves a completed or exhausted  consideration before the new promise to be enforced is made (A) Past (B) Executed (C) Executory (D) Acceptance
Does consideration require equality of promises to be valid? (A) Yes (B) No (C) Maybe (D) None of the above
What is required for a consideration to be valid? (A) Value (B) Equality of promises (C) None of the above  (D) All of the above
What is required for a consideration to be valid? (A) Value (B) Legality of consideration (C) Equality of promises (D) A & B
The following renders a consideration invalid except (A) Value (B) Illegality of consideration (C) Promise to perform an existing obligation (D) Operating on a past consideration
The following renders a consideration invalid except (A) Legality of consideration(B) Illegality of consideration (C) Promise to perform an existing obligation (D) Operating on a past consideration
A valid contract can only be enforceable if the parties have ___ to enter into that type of contract (A) Offer (B) Capacity (C) Consideration (D) Acceptance
